<title level="1" right="Cantrip 1" pfs="Standard">[Forbidden Thought](/Spells.aspx?ID=1139)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Cantrip" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=22" />
<trait label="Enchantment" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=61" />
<trait label="Mental" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=106" />
<trait label="Psychic" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=430" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Dark Archive](/Sources.aspx?ID=129) pg. 21</row>

<row gap="medium">

<row gap="tiny">
<row>**Cast**</row>
<row><actions string="Two Actions" /></row>
<row>[somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)</row>
</row>

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 30 feet

**Target** 1 creature
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Saving Throw** Will

</row>

</column>

---

You place a psychic lock in a foe's mind that prevents it from a specific action. Choose “Strike,” “Stride,” “Cast a Spell,” or a specific action you know the creature to have (such as “Breath Weapon” against a [dragon](/Traits.aspx?ID=50)). If the creature attempts that action on its next turn, it must surmount your lock to do so, causing it to take 1d6 mental damage plus your spellcasting ability modifier (with a [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Will save). The target is then temporarily immune for 1 minute.

---
**Heightened (+1)** The damage increases by 1d6.

---

<column gap="tiny">
**Amp** Your telepathic push is particularly shocking to those who resist it. If the target fails its save, it's also [stunned 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=36).

</column>
name: Forbidden Thought
